comments:
I have a whole bunch of these in my log file.  I think it stemmed from trying to
rename my project and project directory and then refreshing.


!ENTRY org.eclipse.team.cvs.core 4 0 2005-01-28 14:27:58.451
!MESSAGE Synchronization bytes are missing for parent of resource
'/project/testconfig/log4j.properties' in synchronization partner
'org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.syncinfo.CVSBaseResourceVariantTree' on get.
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.CVSException: Synchronization bytes are
missing for parent of resource '/project/testconfig/log4j.properties' in
synchronization partner
'org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.syncinfo.CVSBaseResourceVariantTree' on get.
	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.syncinfo.CVSResourceVariantTree.getResourceVariant(CVSResourceVariantTree.java:136)
	at
org.eclipse.team.core.variants.ResourceVariantTreeSubscriber.getSyncInfo(ResourceVariantTreeSubscriber.java:53)
	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.CVSSyncTreeSubscriber.getSyncInfo(CVSSyncTreeSubscriber.java:77)
	at
org.eclipse.team.core.subscribers.SubscriberChangeSetCollector.getSyncInfo(SubscriberChangeSetCollector.java:368)
	at
org.eclipse.team.core.subscribers.SubscriberChangeSetCollector$EventHandler.handleChange(SubscriberChangeSetCollector.java:178)
	at
org.eclipse.team.core.subscribers.SubscriberChangeSetCollector$EventHandler.doDispatchEvents(SubscriberChangeSetCollector.java:79)
	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.core.BackgroundEventHandler.dispatchEvents(BackgroundEventHandler.java:335)
	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.core.BackgroundEventHandler.processEvents(BackgroundEventHandler.java:315)
	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.core.BackgroundEventHandler$1.run(BackgroundEventHandler.java:154)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

I believe in this case that the exceptions do not indicate a loss of 
funtionality (if I am wrong, please let us know the symptoms). Ideally, we 
shouldn't log unless there was actually loss of funtionality.

The problem was that the cvs tool crapped out on me after I renamed the
directory outside of eclipse and then tried to refresh that change into it.  I
then had to do a bunch more refresh, disconnect, share, refresh, close/open
eclipse and open/close project actions before cvs plugin was happy again.  

I don't rename the project outside of eclipse and try to refresh often and I
didn't keep track of the extact set of actions I performed so I don't really
have a set of specific sypomtoms other than cvs plugin didn't like it very much.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 90585 ***

traces.message: Synchronization bytes are missing for parent of resource '/project/testconfig/log4j.properties' in synchronization partner 'org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.syncinfo.CVSBaseResourceVariantTree' on get.
